.@Neil1808 'Land management' describes a sustainable practice. 'Taming the wild' describes a destructive practice.
.@Neil1808 The distinction we are discussing is not 'good/bad' (moral values), but rather 'destructive/non-destructive' (factual values).
.@Neil1808 May I refer you to this text -> https://t.co/TX0kiAtxdz
.@Neil1808 Attempts to co-classify British colonisation with Aboriginal arrival 50kyo are inherently philosophical exercises, not scientific
.@Neil1808 Moral judgments aside, the proven destructive impacts of British colonists radically outweigh those of of Indigenous Australians.
.@Neil1808 But now that co-classification is being qualified with a moral judgement, viz. diminished responsibility due to ignorance.
.@Neil1808 This conversation began with a co-classification of industrialized 20th British colonists and 50,000 yo Indigenous Australians.
.@Neil1808 Genuinely interested to know what you mean by "in the clear". Do you mean a kind of moral judgement?
.@Neil1808 That view may seem logical from a colonial perspective, but it's not accurate. The science is decisive: https://t.co/NRxb9Igmqu
